skill.name: brainstorming
skill.tagline: Turn ideas into fully formed designs through collaborative dialogue
skill.shortSummary: Brainstorm and refine ideas into detailed designs with structured questioning and validation
skill.fullSummary: This skill helps you transform rough ideas into complete, validated designs through natural conversation. It guides you through understanding your project context, exploring different approaches, and validating information before presenting a detailed design in manageable sections. The process ensures you get a well-thought-out solution that meets your specific needs and constraints.

highlights.title: One Question at a Time
highlights.description: The skill asks questions one at a time to avoid overwhelming you and ensure clear understanding. This focused approach helps refine your idea gradually while keeping the conversation natural and productive.

highlights.title: Multiple Approaches Explored
highlights.description: Before settling on a solution, the skill presents 2-3 different approaches with clear trade-offs. This gives you options to consider and helps you make informed decisions about the best path forward.

highlights.title: Information Validation
highlights.description: All external information is verified for credibility and recency before being used. The skill checks sources, dates, and resolves conflicts to ensure you're working with accurate, up-to-date information.

highlights.title: Incremental Design Review
highlights.description: Designs are presented in small, manageable sections of 200-300 words. After each section, you're asked for feedback to ensure everything looks right before moving forward, preventing major rework later.

highlights.title: Project Context Aware
highlights.description: The skill starts by understanding your current project state, including files, documentation, and recent changes. This context-aware approach ensures solutions fit seamlessly into your existing work.

steps.name: Understand Context
steps.description: Review your current project state and ask focused questions to understand your idea.
steps.details: The skill examines your project files, docs, and recent commits to understand where you're starting from. It then asks targeted questions one at a time to clarify your goals, constraints, and success criteria.

steps.name: Explore Approaches
steps.description: Propose 2-3 different solutions with clear trade-offs and recommendations.
steps.details: Based on your requirements, the skill presents multiple approaches with their pros and cons. It uses web search when needed to gather current information about technologies and provides a clear recommendation with reasoning.

steps.name: Validate Information
steps.description: Verify all external information for credibility, recency, and accuracy.
steps.details: Before using any information, the skill checks source credibility, dates, and resolves conflicting information. This ensures you're working with reliable, up-to-date facts rather than assumptions or outdated knowledge.

steps.name: Present Design
steps.description: Break the complete design into manageable sections and validate each one.
steps.details: The skill presents the final design in small sections covering architecture, components, data flow, and more. After each 200-300 word section, it asks for your feedback to ensure everything aligns with your vision before continuing.

steps.name: Update Plan
steps.description: If in plan mode, automatically update your project plan with the new design.
steps.details: When working with project plans, the skill seamlessly updates your plan file with the newly developed design, keeping your documentation current without requiring manual updates.
